meanings.definition: Having a stale, moldy, or damp smell.
meanings.sent1: The old books in the library had a mustier smell than the new ones.
meanings.sent2: The basement became mustier after the heavy rainstorm.
meanings.sent3: The mustier odor in the attic made the children giggle and hold their noses.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house had a mustier smell than a forgotten cave.
meanings.sent5: The mustier scent of the antique shop lingered in the air long after we left.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of age or neglect.
meanings.sent1: The mustier furniture in the attic looked worn and tired.
meanings.sent2: The mustier pages of the old diary revealed the passage of time.
meanings.sent3: The mustier appearance of the neglected garden made the neighbors concerned.
meanings.sent4: The mustier walls of the ancient castle whispered stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The mustier clothes in the vintage store seemed to hold memories of their previous owners.
